Egyptian [Determinants](Determinants.html) are similar to Sumerian [determinatives](determinatives.html)  

There exist two types of classes in the classification system of Ancient Egyptian that are not found in Sumerian: one classifying events generally realized as verbs, and a few very general and inclusive â€œabstractâ€ classes.  

Like in the revised view about the Egyptian equivalents, most if not all signs had a phonetic value ( optionally spoken), as evidenced by
